title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 51.6 - Method of measuring tread groove pattern depth
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 51.6 - Method of measuring tread groove pattern depth

State Regulations

Tire tread groove pattern depth shall be measured by a
tread depth gauge of a type calibrated in thirty-seconds of an inch. Readings
shall be taken in a major tread groove of the tire nearest to the center at two
points of the circumference not closer than 15 inches. Readings for a tire
which has a tread groove pattern running across the tire or for a siped tire, where such tread groove pattern is permitted, shall be taken at or near the
center of the tire at two points of the circumference not closer than 15
inches. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
51.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
